reviews: Very good latte. The pistachio croissant was also delicious.
Always friendly and fast service, good supplier for coffee beans and supplies. The price point is a bit high for daily visits.
Love the oat-milk cappuccino!

(Translated by Google) A place where you can buy coffee, more marketing than product, more packaging than good ingredients. I asked for a coffee in the Chemex preparation method, and the Colombian coffee lacked acidity, aroma, body, well below the acceptable quality level. The sign outside the coffee shop says Roasters, but they don't roast there, just an over-marketed coffee shop. Accessible prices. They have Wi-Fi.

Amazing taste of coffee around the world! Turkish coffee highly recommend
Lovely ambiance with warm yellow lights. Cute little cafe with delicious coffee! On the pic is seen capuccino with oatmilk. Good prices as well! Def refommend it.

Best vibe, taste, service, and most reasonably priced coffee shop I‚Äôve tried in Toronto! Had a oat cappuccino and usually it‚Äôs made poorly when using this type of milk but it came out really well. Everything is spaced out well too, unlike other small coffee shops where conversation is hard to have. Will definitely be back to try different brews.
Love everything they serve. My fav is the almond croissant..must try that. Coffee is amazing too.
Place is ok. Prices are higher then Tim Hortans but the same taste in coffee imo
Loved their Strawberry Hot Chocolate!
One of the best coffee shops in downtown TO.  Great friendly staff and knowledgeable!
Beautiful place, great service and food! Excellent service
It was once great. Not anymore though.

It's okay if a place doesn't have WiFi, but here they have WiFi sign with password but it never works. Employees don't seem to care about that either. They simply answer "They don't know why it's not working. It works for some". In fact, it doesn't work for anyone. They won't do anything to help with WiFi because they say their system relies on that WiFi and doing anything is risky.

AMAZING coffee bway! Love their single estate blends.
Good coffee at a decent price. Could use more seating inside.

Amazing pastries and warm service. The sea salt hot chocolate is beyond delicious. The space is super cute, just tiny so a tad on the noisy side. Not ideal as a workspace or hangout it you're catching up with an old friend like I was.
Amazing coffee and food
Cute space, friendly baristas and delicious coffee. High quality. Love this coffee shop.
Loved their scones! Staffs are very nice and friendly

Small coffee shop with an incredibly big menu of coffee and brewing methods. You can buy beans and grinds here too. They will make custom mix for you if you wish too. Brew bar offers more than the typical offerings: drip, aeropress, chemex, and syphon too! Service is fast and friendly. Had a v60 drip, cappuccino with oatmilk, cheddar and chive scone and ham and cheese croissant. The pastries were heated up and great! Drinks were also good. Will be back to try more! There is seating inside and outside too.
The coffee is good but the service was subpar at the time.
This is my frequent coffee-to-go place whenever I‚Äôm at Toronto. I like bold taste coffee and the coffee here just suits my taste. The croissant is nice too.

Didn't love the vibe here. Stuffy. Wi-fi didn't work. Coffee is pretty good though.

Was in the neighbourhood. Coffee was excellent!
Great customer service and professional staff members.
A bit pricey but has a nice vibe
Great coffee and croissant. Their reusable mug has a stopper and sleeve on it!
Love the place, lovely and beautifully designed interior, very good coffee and pastries and friendly staff. Couldn‚Äôt ask for a better place.
Fabulous matcha lattes! Great service as well.

Nice staff, good coffee, decent food choices, downtown prices. It's nice to have reliable quality coffee in the neighbourhood!
Dog friendly (at least for ordering you can bring your dog inside)
Hi P√©ter, thanks a lot for your wonderful 5-star review! Really glad that you love our coffee! Can't wait to meet you again soon at our coffee shop!
The iced V60 Colombian beans - best iced coffee I‚Äôve ever tasted
Amazing coffee and staff. Their Turkish coffee and pastries are the best.

New fav spot! I‚Äôm obsessed with their fredo cappuccino with crema. It‚Äôs just like the coffees I would drink on my vacations in Greece. The place is brand new and clean. The staff are professional and the manager was very helpful! Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in the area, and even if you‚Äôre not!
The espresso here is fantastic, it's is perfectly bitter, smoky and delicious. The service is friendly, polite and knowledgeable. The establishment is always clean and the environment is welcoming.
Such a fun experience..staff was incredible!!!!
Good coffee. Great croissants. Must try!
Ice coffee was so good üëç great service too

Luv this Cafe. They have a good selection of coffee to enjoy. Of course, service was excellent and cool. Another place to go to replace my Starbucks addiction. You need to give this place a try. Can't wait to come back.
Very good espresso drink. This is what espresso needs to taste like.
Amazing staff and great coffee!!
What a beautiful little spot! So many coffee options. The coffee and pastries were very good.

I‚Äôm obsessed with this place! They have a cool interior design, professional and friendly baristas, and the best filled croissants! So far, I‚Äôve tried their Turkish coffee (they call it Greek coffee in the menu), banana walnut croissant, and pistachio croissant. My favorite is the banana walnuts so far but I‚Äôm going back to try other ones as well. The only issue is that their roasted beans are slightly overpriced but I like that they sell them in sealed reusable bags.

Friendly and attentive staff, a wide variety of coffee, and the option to buy niche and interesting coffee brewing devices. The selection of coffee, along with the variety of brewing techniques, make this a must visit cafe on it's own, but the baristas truly made the experience for me. After a small problem with one of the machines, the barista remade my coffee 3 times until it was up to par, and went out of his way to ensure he made me the best cup of coffee possible.
The espresso taste is really good. The croissant was delicious too. Nice decor inside and plenty of patio space outside. Friendly service.
Great place for a quality coffee, friendly chat and bite to eat.
Lovely staff!
Cute little coffee shop! Kinda small but they got a great selection of coffee. I got the matcha latte and I have no complaints.

Great neighborhood place, knows their regulars, and decent food options to go with your coffee. There's a lot of people here during weekends but the staff are really quick so there's not a lot of waiting time.

Most likely pet friendly. Very often you'll see dogs just outside, and on the odd day you'll spot a small cat in a trolley
Best croissant ever!

Unfortunately, this cup of single origin americano was over-extracted. Grinds are too fine and there are coffee bean sediments at the bottom of the cup. Also, over-extraction caused the coffee way too sour and astringent, undrinkable . For a $4.5 americano, I hoped it is at least decently crafted. However, I consider this to be an isolated event and would try again next time.
Great coffee place
Fantastic coffee, fantastic beans. Too bad specialty coffee is seasonal. Would have wanted to have some of their offerings year-round. It's excellent.
Great atmosphere

Cute, edgy little coffee joint on Bay St. ‚òïÔ∏èSuper friendly (and cute) staff üòú Was very happy to see a flat white on the menu board üôåüèº Moderately to high priced for the coffee, but it was delicious and worth every penny. Plus nice to be supporting a small, local business üòä

I tried a cortado because I wanted to taste how well the espresso shot was pulled and I was not disappointed. Great technique in preparing and pulling the shot and milk was the perfect texture and temperature. Will be back.
Great Job.
Best coffee in the area hands down!!

love the service and quality of this place. the barista I spoke with was very friendly with explaining different brewing methods and her recommendation for me blew my mind. I will defin come back here to try different brews.

I ordered coffee and scones. I liked their coffee, atmosphere, and location. The owner and the staff were very friendly with good customer service. However, their scones were not fresh/ they were stale...Overall, it is a nice place with a great coffee selection.
Awesome selection, great setup, and very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Will definitely return.
Coffee was great . Love to visit here . Will surely visit here again

I tried their hot and iced chai latte and I loved them both! My friend attests to their great quality coffee (both in drinks and beans). Their pastries are fine. I had their almond croissant which was good but overpriced. Great service.
Overall, great to grab coffee from or hang around in.
This is the place for spanakopita and tyropita (spinach and cheese pie)!
Good vibe of this place. Spanish latte highly recommended
Great coffee & amazing almond croissants!

Can't say how the coffee is since I never got to order anything despite waiting in line for 10 mins. The barista was chatting up with a customer while very slowly preparing the order. The other baristas were just idly looking around and at me waiting in line but none of them seemed willing to take an order. I was in a hurry so I just left and got my mid-day coffee somewhere else. Not bothering with this place again.
Great service from nice staff. Interesting collection of roasts and beans, and ways to brew them. Can use Ritual to pre-order.

Dear Andy, we really thank you for your excellent 5-star review and for sharing your beautiful picture. Our passion is to offer the perfect bespoke coffee experience to all our guests. Can't wait to see you again at our coffee shop!
After walking past this place on my way to work each morning, I decided to stop in for a latte. Milk was so smooth, espresso extracted perfectly. One of the best lattes I‚Äôve had in a while!
I have only been here once but I am giving a 5-star rating for this place being so pocket friendly while delivering great and artisanal coffee experience.
If I were lost at sea and stranded on an island, I really hope it's Coffee Island.
Lovely experience, a variety of coffees available including flavours and methods. Very patient and friendly service as well. A must try.
The service was perfect, they have so much coffee and great food you can try! Super recommended

Found Coffee Island by doing a Google search for coffee shops near the hotel I was staying at. I intended to get take out only, but it was so cute that I ended up sitting in for a little while. I got a drip coffee and a flavoured croissant, and they were both very good! I noticed that the staff knew a lot of the regulars‚Äô names and orders, and helped someone purchase whole beans as a gift. Overall, a great experience at Coffee Island!

I loved the coffee. I tried the Sumatra. I had never had Syphon coffee and was very impressed. They have 4-5 different brewing methods. The baristas are pretty knowledgeable as well.
The croissant was whatever, I would say stick to the coffee, don't bother with the food.
The coffee here is amazing, they offer different coffee blends from different countries. The brownie cookies are fantastic, and the place has a great design.
Quick service, warm and cozy atmosphere and the tastiest coffee in town I've had so far! Starting from today - my #1 destination for a cup of cappuccino))

Some rude/unpleasant staff. It was my first visit. I was just asking about their products and learn about their original coffee. It seems they were not too enthusiastic or customer friendly for that matter. Never coming here again. Their regular brew was mediocre, but price was reasonable.

Overall decor and atmosphere was pleasant.
Great coffee, great service, great environment.

Employees seem nice, food looks good, didn‚Äôt get to try it though. Being offered outside seating like a dog didn‚Äôt feel right, due to a friend‚Äôs medical condition. I remember when peoples private lives were private!
The best latte and excellent costumer service.
Great spot for a coffee shop as there‚Äôs not much around the immediate area. The coffee beans are more on the acidic side, which personally not my taste.
Great location and nice patio. The owners are nice. It has a wide selection of coffee beans.

Excellent coffee, reheat our croissant to perfection!
Very goodüôÇ ‚Ä¶
Favourite coffee chain from Greece, in downtown Toronto! Great coffee and nice outdoor seating
Love the service... . I've never been disappointed. Love üíö ‚Ä¶
Some of the best coffee I‚Äôve ever had, full stop. Didn‚Äôt even get mad at me when I accidentally ordered a siphon coffee when there was a long line. Also gives my dog a treat every time I come in.

I visited Coffee Island for the second time and when I walked in, barista (tall girl with curly hair and glasses) was sweeping the floor and without washing hands started taking my order. I asked for dark roast and since the dark roast coffee container was almost empty, she just topped up my cup from the medium roast container. If that wasn't enough, the blueberry scone I ordered was rubbery and not really fresh. It's a shame because I really liked their coffee on my first visit.
Nice selection of beans.
Very nice place to have coffee and sit outside. Staff is very knowledgeable.
rude staff
Great coffee and place, I'd like to talk with employees but they had no time to chat.
Great coffee, atmosphere, and service. Great place to kickoff your day.

Pandemic update: their service & coffee are still exceptional. One note - when ordering, be prepared that they have a lot of cup sizes to offer. 12 Oz is closer to your expected regular size in any other high quality coffee chain. I keep making mistake with ordering 8 Oz :)

This coffee place also has a lot of very tasty pastries. You should check it out!

Great coffee, fast service, welcoming environment. They support tap payments and Ritual. Their service overall gets better each day. Fantastic

Not great coffee. Nice patio.

One of the baristas that served me was really friendly.

Incredibly rude staff. None of their food or coffee is worth their holier than thou attitude.

I live in Greece which is where the first Coffe Island started and with me living in the centre of Athens im surrounded by Coffee Island shops.Years ago I went to a Coffee Island for the first time with a friend where I got a cold chocolate with strawberry flavor and since then that's the only thing that I've been purchasing from that chainsaw for years.I highly recommended to buy cold chocolate with strawberry flavor since it's to die for but idk if they will make it the same in Toronto

Unreasonably rude staff.
Don‚Äôt even go there unless you want to ruin your mood .
Don‚Äôt recommend !!!

The environment here is really unfriendly. I was translating for a friend and the staff seemed annoyed with us. They were completely uninterested in answering questions we had about the menu. Admittedly, the coffee selection is impressive as are the modes of preparation.

Long time customer here.  I've probably spent over 1,000$ here as I live 1 minute away.  I ALWAYS support small business over Starbucks and Tim Hortons so would support this place whenever I could.  Their prices are more than Tim's or Starbucks but again, I don't care as I prefer to support small businesses and would rather support the local community. However, I dealt with a disgustingly rude staff member a few weeks ago and will never be attending this coffee shop again.
Tasty but very expensive for the sizing.

Product amazing the 1 staff on location was literally rude as hell. Will just uber eats it to my place next time. I was so excited to see it in Toronto since I frequent Greece - not the same experience by any means.
Walked past the shop and decided to stop by. Ordered a latte and it was great. Good vibes inside the store and fast service. Will be back

Coffee Island offers a good selection of coffees with a wide range of brewing methods.  But the staff were not particularly friendly or interested in discussing their products.  I ordered a light roast and the staff secretly pumped medium roast into the cup, probably because the light roast had run out... (at 9:45 in the morning?).
My favourite go to coffee shop when I am in Toronto. Friendly, efficient staff who go above and beyond for their customers. Many thanks!!
Helpful staff. Great coffee. Nice atmosphere

Excellent service, excellent place and quality product üëå ‚Ä¶
nice tea and place.
Better than Starbucks.

I've been there twice. The coffee is good, the place is beautiful, but the lady who prepares coffee is a little rude. I don't feel comfortable been attended to by her. I love coffee, I go to coffee shops frequently and, I can say that it's not common to see baristas like her.

Hands down one of the best places to get coffee in Toronto. They have an amazing selection of single source java and the taste gets me every time. Not too sour or bitter, just the right balance that doesn't make you acidic:). Oh, and their chocolate almond croissant- the best I've had in Toronto

This is a cute little place on the Bay and Wellesley corridor and they have really nice staff! We were on a fall walk and didn't carry any credit cards on us. We had recently activated google pay (so, we weren't sure if it would work or not).

We told the lady at the counter to try charging us first to make sure it went through - and she was like "that's fine, you guys obviously live in the area - you can drop by and pay later if it does not work"

Our payment worked :)

Very genuine and friendly customer service - that's really difficult to find these days. Kudos to their staff!

The coffee was great. They also have flavored hot chocolate (my wife tried the strawberry one - it tasted like the red quality street chocolate, for the one's who know it!)

Great place. Do check out if you are in the neighborhood.

The coffee and espresso is so flavourful and delicious. The croissants are buttery and light - among the best I‚Äôve had in the city. The staff are so warm, knowledgeable and friendly making this my favourite cafe in TO

Friendly service, delicious treats, quality packaging and incredibly flavourful beans. This is my go to. I‚Äôve taken a few friends here, or brewed their coffee at home for friends and it‚Äôs always a hit.

My favorite small business coffee shop and you should support it too! Great staff, great service, even better coffee.

Huge range of coffee beans and coffee methods at reasonable pricing.
Great coffee
Nice lattes

Nothing short of an overall amazing experience is to be expected when visiting this wonderful establishment. It's located near Queen's park so you can't go wrong stopping by for a coffee and pastry on your way to the park. Highly recommend!
Very nice coffee  with loads of different brewing methods.

I've been here twice.  Both times the staff were not wearing masks.  Today the barista was not wearing a mask and not washing hands between cleaning the counter and serving food.  The latte was good, but I couldn't eat the croissant after it was touched with unwashed hands.

2020.09.12. A quick visit for a walkthrough coffee. I had my "Turkish Coffee" prepared on hot sand. One comment to the staff "Please wear your mask at all tines". Sat on the patio outside.

Great coffee selection with lots of the interesting options to try from. They also offer several brewing methods to which mean you there are plentiful way to enjoy you coffee.

Awesome coffee spot. You can literally get coffee any way you like it. They have more brewing methods than I can remember and a huge selection of beans, and flavors. I‚Äôm not sure why this place is rated this well given how terrible my experience was. I came in looking to have an iced mocha - a very typical drink available in most cafes; but I suppose not here.

As I was asking if it was available and told no by the person at the counter, i said can I order hot mocha with ice. He said sure; but then out of nowhere the owner (or manager?) maybe in the most patronizing tone told me that it‚Äôs very important to know your drink and that the only way to make an iced mocha is by making it an ice blended drink. She continued on saying that "you need to trust us on this; how else would you make an iced mocha if not to blend it with ice ". I held off my thought since I really didn‚Äôt  want to make any scene there; but FYI ma‚Äôam; people have been making iced mochas since forever. In my mind also, what kind of a cafe would this be with this kind of manager/owner. Even another customer next to me said in front of an employee that she‚Äôs had lots of iced mochas in other cafes.

So I went on to order and iced latte and was asked if I wanted to add a chocolate shot in it; and I said why not. But I got the drink and realized wow - I now kind of understand why; this was possibly the worst "iced latte" I‚Äôve ever had in my life. I‚Äôve been drinking coffee since I was 6 so I know a thing or two about the drinks; and that was by no means an iced latte. I think McDonald‚Äôs iced coffee might have been a better choice.

The only salvation for this place was the nice little patio it has with good internet; but that‚Äôs about it I‚Äôd say. I‚Äôd not be coming back - that‚Äôs for sure
